intro: Aquilegia brachyceras, commonly known as the short-stemmed columbine, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, characterized by its showy, spurred flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring compound leaves with three to five leaflets. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, with five sepals that are often mistaken for petals. Aquilegia brachyceras thrives in well-drained soils and partial shade, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and woodland borders.
